Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Delightful \De*light"ful\, a. Highly pleasing; affording great pleasure and satisfaction. ``Delightful bowers.'' --Spenser. ``Delightful fruit.'' --Milton.
Syn: Delicious; charming. See {Delicious}. -- {De*light"ful*ly}, adv. -- {De*light"ful*ness}, n. [1913 Webster]
delightfully adv : in a delightful manner; "the farm house, though in itself a small one, is delightfully situated"
